meanings.definition: Relating to the scientific study of trees and woody plants.
meanings.sent1: The dendrological research team discovered a new species of tree in the forest.
meanings.sent2: Her dendrological expertise helped identify the different types of trees in the park.
meanings.sent3: The dendrological expert joked that the trees were having a 'wooden' party.
meanings.sent4: His dendrological knowledge was as deep-rooted as the oldest tree in the grove.
meanings.sent5: Learning about dendrological topics made her see the forest in a whole new light.

meanings.definition: The branch of botany that deals with trees and shrubs.
meanings.sent1: Studying dendrological helps us understand the importance of trees in our ecosystem.
meanings.sent2: The dendrological at the botanical garden shared fascinating facts about different tree species.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel teased the dendrological about knowing all the tree secrets.
meanings.sent4: In the world of business, he was the dendrological, always rooted in growth and development.
meanings.sent5: The children were amazed by the dendrological's ability to identify trees just by their leaves.
